required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: To Evaluate Safety and Tolerability After Multiple Oral Doses of AZD1656 in Type 2 Diabetes Patients on Top of Insulin
clinical_study.official_title: A Randomized, Single-Blind, Placebo-Controlled, Phase I Study to Assess the Safety, Tolerability, Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics After Multiple Ascending Oral Doses of AZD1656 in Subjects With T2DM Treated With Insulin

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to assess safety and tolerability of AZD1656 after multiple repeated oral doses in patients with type 2 diabetes on top of insulin.

primary_outcome.measure: Safety variables (AE, BP, pulse, weight, plasma glucose, laboratory variables and ECG)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken repeatedly during 24 hours on study day sessions

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples taken repeatedly during 24 hours on study day sessions
Blood samples taken repeatedly during 24 hours on study day sessions

intervention.description: Dose titration of oral suspension to a tolerable dose in 2-3 dose steps. Investigational product given twice daily for eight days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Female with non child-bearing potential
- Diagnosed Diabetes Mellitus patients treated with insulin alone or insulin in combination with other anti-diabetic drugs. Stable blood sugar control indicated by no changed treatment within 3 months prior to study start.
- HbA1c below or equal to 11 % at screening (HbA1c value according to international DCCT standard)
Exclusion Criteria:
- Clinically significant illness or clinically relevant trauma, as judged by the investigator, within two weeks before the first administration of the IP
- History of ischemic heart disease, stroke, transitorisk ischemic attack or symptomatic peripheral vascular disease
- Clinically significant abnormalities in clinical chemistry, hematology, or urinalysis results.

overall_official.affiliation: Profil Institut for Clinical Research Inc.

responsible_party.name_title: Klas Malmberg, MD, PhD, Prof. Medical Science Director, Emerging Products
